### Serverless AI Pipeline (Edge-to-Cloud)

<div class="project-text">
Designed to achieve **sub-100ms defect detection** in manufacturing environments, this pipeline integrates **AWS Greengrass** and **IoT Core** for robust edge computing. By deploying PyTorch models directly to the edge, I eliminated cloud latency, ensuring real-time inference while maintaining a serverless Lambda backend for asynchronous data aggregation and analytics.
</div>

![](images/Serverless AI Pipeline for Quality Inspection description.png){group="projects" description="Serverless AI Pipeline Architecture"}

<div class="project-action">
[**View Code on GitHub**](https://github.com/Najo1on1/Serverless-AI-Pipeline-for-High-Throughput-Quality-Inspection-on-AWS){.btn .btn-primary role="button"}
</div>


### Carbon-Aware Agentic Scheduler

<div class="project-text">
A multi-agent system built with **LangGraph** that dynamically schedules AI training jobs based on real-time grid carbon intensity. By integrating "Watcher" and "Scheduler" agents, the system autonomously shifts heavy compute workloads to low-carbon time windows, achieving a demonstrated **13.4% reduction in CO2 emissions** during simulation.
</div>

![](images/Carbon-Aware Scheduler System Architecture_diagram.png){group="projects" description="Multi-Agent Scheduler Architecture"}

<div class="project-action">
[**View Code on GitHub**](https://github.com/Najo1on1/carbon-aware-scheduler){.btn .btn-primary role="button"}
</div>

### EuroAgri Pipeline

<div class="project-text">
I engineered this scalable data system to harmonize heterogeneous geospatial inputs into climate-adaptive agronomic insights. The pipeline features a custom **heuristic imputation engine** for missing soil chemistry data (Nitrogen/Phosphorus) and automates the transformation of raw weather logs into structured **Parquet datasets** and a traversable **Neo4j Knowledge Graph**.
</div>

### Net-Load Forecasting with MC-Dropout

<div class="project-text">
My Master's dissertation focused on **calibrated uncertainty quantification** for the Irish Power System, moving beyond simple point predictions. I developed a **Monte Carlo Dropout LSTM** network to predict net-load volatility and implemented a **Deep SVDD** (Support Vector Data Description) model for residual-based anomaly detection, statistically outperforming ARIMA-GARCH baselines.
</div>

![](images/Irish Power Modular System Architecture.png){group="projects" description="System Architecture: Bayesian LSTM & Anomaly Detection Pipeline"}
